name: BONEWORKS

reviews: When I had first picked this game up, I had a hard time getting into it and ended up putting it down for a while. After my VR legs got a bit stronger, I came back and was absolutely blown away. I know this game came out some time ago now but I was finally able to experience it in all its glory. My only complaint is that there isn't more. Also, the soundtrack is perfect. Michael Wyckoff fully understood the assignment.

This game is just amazing. Like, the physics, the graphics, the gameplay, the story, the creators, the soundtrack, the design, the characters—everything about this game is amazing. I've played Bonelab before, but it is nothing compared to this game.

I’ve got 10.8 hours on it, and I don’t think I’m even halfway done (probably because I’m goofing around with the physics too much). And OMG, the sandbox? A M A Z I N G. It’s so much fun—it’s like you’re in real life, but you can do whatever you want. There are mods too if you want to experience something new.

If you haven’t bought it yet, I don’t know what you’re doing reading this. Go buy it.

If i ever get asked the question, "If you could play any game for the first time again, what would it be?" It would easily be BONEWORKS, Boneworks is a phenomenal game, with so much rich story and lore I have a hard time understanding it half the time, its gameplay is very smooth (if you have a good connection lol) and the guns are amazing compared to other vr games guns, its gameplay is simple to understand with neat physics based movement and gameplay and an entire modding scene you can get into when you're done! The soundtrack is one of the best and most fitting with clean synthetic tracks mixed with old fantasy themed tracks. The next game, BONELAB mixes the dark fantasy and synthetic simulation themes together perfectly, I could do an entire second review on Bonelab but I don't own that on my steam account, shucks. ):

Boneworks is a fine game. It's just that, and exactly that. It's fine. 

It does an awful lot of things, and none of them are going to wow you if you've played the likes of Blade and Sorcery, or HLAlyx. The melee is clumsy to the point of bare usability, the shooting is fine, but some guns aren't responsive for reloading, the puzzles require seconds of thought, and minutes of cumbersome manoeuvring. The story is... There. It's got some acting and voice acting, and even something like a plot, but it's forgettable. But despite all this mediocrity, it does boast an impressive collection of stuff, and that alone is worth something. I'm not sure what, but something. 

Overall, Boneworks is a game you get on a hefty sale, to add to your repertoire of "fuck about" games. It's repetitive and predictable, but fun nonetheless.

6/10.

short_description: BONEWORKS is an Experimental Physics VR Adventure. Use found physics weapons, tools, and objects to fight across dangerous playscapes and mysterious architecture.
